website_summaries.verdict: Guides teens through the process of building a doorbell, electronic dice, motion sensor alarm, and more.
pros: Comes with microprocessor, light sensor, speaker, jumper wires, and much more to build 50 circuitry projects
Includes real wiring, unlike some competitors
May be most attractive to younger end of teen spectrum
cons: Some are too tight to easily install without damaging
others are too loose and don't make a secure connection

customer_reviews.title: It was a great addition!
customer_reviews.text: I teach 5th grade science. I use Elenco Snap Circuits throughout the year. I added this product to my hands-on centers. It was a great addition!!! One of my brightest students exclaimed, "Now I feel like I am actually wiring something!" It has held up to daily use by 3 classes so far. If nothing gets broken in the first few uses and kids can work it out of the box without asking me 20 questions or just giving up, I consider it a success. This product and the seller were problem free for me. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for an 8 year old who is curious about electricity
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 8 year old who is interested in all things mechanical and electrical. This educational toy has exceeding my expectations as the book is also fabulous and teaches the underlying electrical principles. My son loves playing with this and making the lights and sounds in the various circuits.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set!
customer_reviews.text: My boys (ages 9, 7, & 6) love this set!! They got it for Christmas and have built every single thing in it. Thier favorite project was building a doorbell for thier bedroom door. So cool! They are great at building Lego sets, so they were able to follow the manual and make all the various items without help. They love creating things and I love that they are using thier brains and hands to make something of thier very own. Total win!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great set for homeschool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to learn about circuits. It has real wires too hook up to real components such as push buttons, LED lights, speaker, microprocessor and more (not like the cheap circuit sets). My only complaint, which is minuscule, is that the wires can be difficult to push in sometimes and the wire ends bend easily. That could be frustrating for younger kids. We received it as part of the Amazon STEM club. We currently use this set in our homeschool for science.. My son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: shannon ra

customer_reviews.title: Rounding up to 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Received this as part of the Amazon STEM subscription for 8-13 year olds. My 7 year old son is picky. This, he loves; therefore, I love. He spent almost 3 hours just today working on the first 17 builds. The set has a total of 50 builds in the instructions. I'm not a fan exactly of the instructions format, but we figured it out, and he rolled on by himself after the 2nd build. This is definitely worth the money, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: TwinMomVA

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son is obsessed with this and absolutely loves it. With all the things he can do with it and keeps his mind busy while learning is a plus. The wires can be hard to put into the little sockets sometimes but other than that I think it's such a good product and I would highly suggest it to any child that is hands on and has an interest in how things work and creating things.
customer_reviews.author: susan marruffo

customer_reviews.title: Interesting and educational.
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting toy for kids, they learn a little science and have fun at the same time. However the base piece is a little hard to put together as a cube, it connects on one side then get loose on the other side. But otherwise, there are 50 ways to play and connect parts to show lights in different colors, flashing lights, dim and brighten lights with a dial, different sounds, control sounds with a dial etc. Interesting and educational.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley louis

customer_reviews.title: 8-year-old loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son really really likes this and uses it for hours some days, building different circuits, small games (ping pong lights), etc. He's really interested in the concepts and enjoys the challenge of building the projects in the book.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to buy this for my 9-year-old given the great reviews. The packaging and instructions looked great and we got started building the first circuit. We immediately noted that the connections were extremely loose. We tried pushing them in tighter and wiggling them in every direction but there was no consistent way to make a connection, particularly to the positive terminal of the battery module. We're unfortunately returning it as it would be beyond aggravating to try and build a larger circuit with these conditions. Maybe we received a defective model but I'm not interested in taking another chance and would rather try another company with hopefully a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: SharaK

customer_reviews.title: NOT for ages 8+ and hard to use
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are confusing. It says the kit is for ages 8+ but I’m havinga hard time helping my 12 year old with it. Additionally, the wires are very hard to push into the circuit boards without bending. I wouldn’t recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Millard

customer_reviews.title: This Made Me Love Science!
customer_reviews.text: I hated science as a kid, and especially despised the units we'd learn about electricity. However, my 6-year old LOVES STEM toys, so I thought this might be fun for him and his dad. :) Well, I played it with him the first time on a snow day from school, and I was hooked!! The booklet lays out each activity (I think there's 45 total) with easy to follow instructions and explanations and diagrams that explain how circuits work, in language a 6-year old (or anti-science minded parent) can understand! The activity book flows in a logical manner so each activity/lesson builds upon what you learned previously. I'm looking forward to more "playtime" with our new toy! :)
customer_reviews.author: Mommy2Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great idea;  construction could be improved or QA
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this project kit and it works great when the wiring fits exactly how it should when you plug then into the holes that are available.. problem is some holes are extremely loose and other holes are extremely tight causing the pins to bend or you have go fiddle with the loose connection to make it get a solid connection. If this worked 100% as advertised this would be an easy 5 stars but I can't give it more than 2 for this situation we are dealing with.
customer_reviews.author: The bargain guy

customer_reviews.title: Super fun but delicate
customer_reviews.text: This product brought many hours of building for my child. She loved that she could make games, which was one of the best parts of the set. The only downside was the connector wires are delicate/hard to push in the components and she isn't super careful, so there was some bending and over repeated usage I imagine they might break. Not a huge issue and for the price I can't complain too much, but if your kid is as rough as mine, supervision might be a good idea until they are mature enough to not break things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Repetitive Shipping
customer_reviews.text: After taking a break in the program for a few months I started having the items sent again to my grandchildren, both of the last two items sent were duplications of previous offerings. I’m a little frustrated and wonder if this repetition will continue. In the meantime the family has nice birthday gifts available for friends.
customer_reviews.author: GIna

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but let down by quality control on key components.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my bright 9-year old’s birthday. By coincidence, someone else had purchased the same set. He enjoyed both experimenting and following the directions but, in both sets, the ‘light sensor’ component failed to work. This rendered several of the builds useless and was a big disappointment as when the first set failed we thought that at least we had a spare. Follow-Up: I contacted the manufacturer and they sent out a replacement sensor free of charge. Good for them!
customer_reviews.author: MJD

customer_reviews.title: Wires didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: Some of the holes did not accept the wires or were extremely loose. This made it very difficult to do many of the experiments. Sent it back for a replacement. We'll see how that works.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vallejo

customer_reviews.title: To technical
customer_reviews.text: My kids didn’t like it. Not a mind opener for them.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Sparked curiosity that lasted through the week
customer_reviews.text: 9-11 Yr old range. Both kids loved it. Arrived very compartmentalized and organized. My kids did the suggested exercises and then went around the house figuring out what else could be used to complete circuits. I loved seeing them get so excited about learning! I also loved that they could put everything back in it's place and easily get it back out.
customer_reviews.author: Hinkerdink

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Fav ... until it got hot and melted!
customer_reviews.text: Grandson (aged 11) was gifted for Christmas. He absolutely loved this. He created several projects. However, the battery got hot enough and melted the unit down. His dad was working with him at the time and said there was some smoke as well. Not sure if this is an isolated incident or not. Unit was thrown away before I had a chance to send for refund or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I love that the manual it comes with does a clear ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 7yo son for Christmas and he is loving it. The wires can be hard to push into some of the circuits, but it's not too big of a deal as he can push most in himself. I love that the manual it comes with does a clear job explaining what is happening and the visuals are nice. He loves to see that he is the one who made a reaction happen, and it builds his confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 10 years old son to keep his hands busy stead of playing games all the time. PRO: direction easy to follow. He did it all by himself. He enjoys making variety of builds. CON: difficult at time to insert the wires into the board, causing the metal part to bent. Other complaint, it drains batteries very fast. It requires 3 AAA batteries and only lasted maybe an hour or 2. Overall great experience, so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Best gift to foster curiosity
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12-year-old niece who lives in India. She's very creative and curious. Due to quarantine situations, kids cannot go out and play. I decided to send her smart circuits to foster her creativity and learn about circuits. In a single day, she completed more than 5 projects. She enjoyed developing projects. The material in the box is easy to follow. She did everything without help from adults. I totally recommend this product for all the growing curious kids
customer_reviews.author: supritkumar shah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for a 10 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas gift for a 10 year old. It's provided hours and hours of entertainment with the 50 projects available and he's even found ways to alter the wires on the projects he's completed to make them doing different things too. Simple instructions, hes been able to do everything himself no parental assistance required. Every project he's attempted has worked. His favorites are the light sensor, DJ playback, and the fart sound frenzy game. Great value for the price! If you're on the fence, don't be just get it!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: 10 Year Old Future Engineer Loves
customer_reviews.text: We have used lots of Snap Circuits in the past. I decided to give this set a try for my curious 10 year old. Initially he got frustrated as they seemed more confusing that Snap Circuits, however, he quickly figured them out and independently began programming. Please note, they are able to program some obnoxious sounds, so be prepared. Of course my son liked to make the farting sounds.
customer_reviews.author: TeacherMom

customer_reviews.title: A neat gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson, who is twelve. It's really cleverly made, with an excellent instruction booklet, though he and I both feel we need to work on it together so I can give him some additional explanations. I'm not an electrical expert, but am slightly familiar. He enjoys getting the circuits to light up, etc, and it's very safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Toy for 3rd .. 6th Graders
customer_reviews.text: I had an electronics kit when I was growing up. While this is a step below that, the basics it is teaching have gone a long way to pique the interest of my children. Unlike the more advanced kits, this appears to be hardened against wiring mistakes provided you're using only components from the kit. Definitely worth it for elementary students. 3rd-6th grade.
customer_reviews.author: mixer 1979

customer_reviews.title: Really Neat
customer_reviews.text: This really works! My 12 year old son has alot of fun changing the wires and boards to do different things, his favorite is the DJ configuration he loves all the different sounds he is able to create. I will say some wires are hard to put into the circuit board and some boards are hard to assemble you feel like their going to break sometimes. So far so good though, nothing has broke and their is so many possibilities of creating different things! I like that my son has something to get his mind working and to see his face light up when he just finished making it work!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Valadez

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy - Manual Missing - Nowhere To Download - Buy Snap Circuits Instead
customer_reviews.text: This product sounds like a lot of fun. My son loves Snap Circuits so we decided to try this. Unfortunately a new package that was wrapped in shrink wrap contained NO manual or instructions making this essentially a useless product. Save your time and money and do NOT buy this. Instead look at Snap Circuits!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to mobile device entertainment
customer_reviews.text: This is a great activity for any parent looking for entertainment alternatives. In the age of electronics kids spend hours doing mindless things on their mobile devices. Break them away with this engaging thought provoking activity which is sure to challenge their creativity!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: natasha smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun. And easy enough for mom to figure out. Really impressed with the book of instructions that it comes with. Actually really well laid out and easy to follow directions. The color coding helps a lot too. My 8 year old can do all the connections himself which just tells you how well written the book is.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: If u have boys ages 9 thru 16 this is the Roy for them! My boys need boredom busters! Instead of mindless play, this entertained them while making them use their brain muscle! Win win! Worth every penny! They also loved playing pranks with it like each time I opened the fridge door, it would bark! So fun!
customer_reviews.author: ICU2

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: This showed up with a battery pack that had loose wires inside. My daughter tried to do the very first build and the lights would not go on. That's when we discovered the problem. Thankfully, we have someone in the family who soldered things correctly. For the price of this item, this should not have been an issue. Quality is less than desirable. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Hmmmm

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for an 8 and 5 year olds
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for an 8 and 5 year olds :) Only problem - defective light detector, and I cannot find a way to contact the manufacturer, and that means that we can't do a big part of experiments.
customer_reviews.author: Anna A.

customer_reviews.title: wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: so far, this was my daughter's favorite STEM package since we started the monthly program. She still has her "Doorbell" on her bedroom door! She LOVES THIS! I even thought the circuit making experiments were fun and enjoyed doing this with her. The instructions are very easy to understand, step-by-step, and the product works just as it specifies. I highly recommend. There were numerous activities in just this one kit! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: MUST READ!
customer_reviews.text: Once you insert that metal part of the wire into the holes they won’t stay in place causing the lights to turn off. If you need to use more wires and try to keep lights on... you will need more than two hands to play this game. And sometimes you just like to go solo. So... that was a turn off.
customer_reviews.author: Monica S.

customer_reviews.title: Smart Circuits
customer_reviews.text: My 8-year-old daughter received this for Christmas, and she absolutely loves it! With some quick guidance on how to press the wires into the boards she was off and building. What is really nice is how the projects are relatable to real world applications. Definately worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Xebra

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, very difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son's 8th birthday as he loves science and wanted a circuits set. The book is informative, although I wish it went into more detail about what the components are. The one major drawback is that the boards and the wires are very, very difficult to assemble. The plastic pieces are tough to push together. My son cannot put the boards together and I have to help, and I have a hard time with it also. The wires do not easily go in also. This would be so much better if the setup wasn't so frustrating. Despite this though, he loves it and has been playing with it almost nonstop.
customer_reviews.author: Starla

customer_reviews.title: Super customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit for my grandson and put it aside (about 2 years ago). Just recently, I brought it out and discovered that the batteries were still in the power pack and had leaked, corroding a metal post and rendering it unusable. I contacted the company and they replaced the battery pack. I didn't even need to return the damaged one.
customer_reviews.author: Johnh96813

customer_reviews.title: A Hit with 12 yr old
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yr old grandson has had fun putting things together. Not sure how much of the background info he is reading, or how technical his understanding of electronics is. For the price, it has been a good gift that I'm sure he will pull out regularly to experiment with. And it is something we can do together too.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jennifer Cook

customer_reviews.title: STEM Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Very nice project. My son has enjoyed this product. He enjoys building things and this has peeked his interest. I think the materials are a little poor for the price but I have enjoyed playing with this with my son.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Mitchem

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for an 8 year old boy. Lots of ways to wire the board, hours of entertainment if your kid likes this type of activity
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: This is hands down the best educational toy that my kids have
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best educational toy that my kids have. My son has been plowing through the projects almost completely independently. There are a ton of super fun projects. It really teaches kids to have an eye for detail and how to very carefully follow instructions. The book is very user friendly and easy to follow with lots of pictures and diagrams.
customer_reviews.author: Immortal Wombat

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the young minds thinking
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item to keep minds working during COVID. My son has enjoyed making a couple different projects. It comes with instructions to create different projects as well which helps kids be creative and confident to maybe work out a project they make up.
customer_reviews.author: Mama28spencer

customer_reviews.title: Distanced Learning-great addition to the lesson plan!
customer_reviews.text: Distanced Learning-great addition to the lesson plan! This was a great STEAM project! I gave 4 stars because the battery pack needed to be adjusted internally but was super easy fix. My son is 10 and was able to to follow the directions and build out the ping pong game. I wouldn’t suggest spending $40 but I got it as part of the monthly subscription Amazon offers.
customer_reviews.author: Mama2TCK

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea
customer_reviews.text: My nephew in 3rd grade loves it! At first he seemed bummed because a good amount of the projects are easy but he kept on trying them all. The he called me one day to tell me that he was able to hook up his mom’s phone to it via bluetooth? Not sure what he means exactly but he was excited. This from a kid who loves technology and a good challenge, so to him it’s probably more of a toy but it’s better than another lego set.
customer_reviews.author: ducha

customer_reviews.title: Be your own engineer!
customer_reviews.text: If your kid is into STEM toys and gadgets then yours will absolutely love it as much as my 10y old little nerd does. So many projects and so many ways these wires can even make light show or color change. Its really enjoyable to see the reaction when they follow the easy instructions on the pamphlet it came with.
customer_reviews.author: Tehmine Yalbuzdag

customer_reviews.title: Money Well Spent
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this subscription package for my 10 year old son for Christmas. He has loved both sets. This circuit set has kept him busy for the past two days. The directions are very well explained and in 5 minutes he had one set done. Over 50 things to create with this set. He has had a ball and loves how easy it is to change the projects. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: book loving mamma

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy to keep a kid entertained for a while
customer_reviews.text: Fun toy to keep a kid entertained for a while. There are enough factory setups to keep them busy for a while. If the kid is inclined, they can be inventive and come up with their own, although many kids may not as it take a bit of trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: Steve F

customer_reviews.title: Fun Educational Tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great kit to teach ten year old about basic electronics. The experiments were straightforward and fun. The various blinking lights and speaker noise made the project outcomes entertaining. Kit is well put together with 15+ mini projects.
customer_reviews.author: J. Urso

customer_reviews.title: An electric experience!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my nearly 9-year old grandson and with him it ranked right up there with another gift of our which was a personally autographed baseball of his favorite player! That is really saying something!
customer_reviews.author: Jean C

customer_reviews.title: Keeps them busy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very active intelligent child and this was amazing for him! We received it today and it’s been over an hour and he’s only a quarter of the way through the book. There are 50 different designs you can do . Really great toy!
customer_reviews.author: cally

customer_reviews.title: The probability of the activities to work is 50/50
customer_reviews.text: The connectivity of the one we recieved wasnt great. All the parts were there but there was alot of troubleshooting and some activites just didnt work even following the instructions. 50/50 the one you receive works well
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice idea, but my 8 year old had trouble getting the wires in the holes straight and the connecting wires got bent after one session. One of the buttons was also broken and I had to open the casing to try to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Great intro to circuits for kids.. lots of projects to do
customer_reviews.text: The kids LOVE this kit, the instructions are WONDERFUL and explain everything that's going on.. my daughter was able to do all of the projects herself once she got the hang of it.. the connection pins do tend to bend a little but none have broke to we are totally happy.. there are so many different projects to do. great value
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old loved this!
customer_reviews.text: We received this through the STEM subscription box and it was an unexpected win. Some of the other boxes, my son looked at for a few minutes and set them aside. He keeps coming back to work through the different projects on this. They are easy to connect and you are able to see quick results. Plus, there are a lot of projects that he can do with this set. I am very happy that we came across this set.
customer_reviews.author: Marla

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy. It is fun and teaches at the same time. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Pruitt Lee Smith

customer_reviews.title: Parent-child bonding
customer_reviews.text: My engineer husband wanted to work with circuits/building computers with our 5 year old. The 5 year old is much more interested in this than he is in building computers. My husband is happy to have something fun to use with our kids and explain the way it works. We are very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Challenging and fun
customer_reviews.text: Fun and challenging. My 5 year old and 7 year both enjoy playing with this. They can independently build these circuits and the variety of the projects holds their interest. This is the toy they both reach out to more often than any others. I got this as part of the Amazon STEM toy subscription nwhich I highly recommend to anyone looking to get quality toys at a discounted rate. You can cancel this subscription any time but once you start you will be hooked and will never want to cancel. Truly great toys
customer_reviews.author: Sowmya

customer_reviews.title: A little boys big disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: My kid was all excited all day long to get this. Comes home we open it and we see this. Battery comparent was all screwed up. Missing springs. Worse we had told him it came from Santa!!!! Told him we must have confused it with someone else's gift to him. I hope this company is reading this, because you really disappointed a little boy who has been looking forward to this. Nice job Smart Lab. Ok. Done venting.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: It’s Electrifying!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic item, this gave my 8 year old boy hours of fun! For days he did experiment upon experiment, determined to complete over 100 activities. It really helped him develop his understanding of electronics. I would highly recommend this product to an aspiring young scientists out there!
customer_reviews.author: Titan Brave

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for the Little Engineers
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical with the quality of the product but I have to say, this is the most played with Christmas gift yet. My son(8 yrs old)can play with it on his own without any assistance. He was able to figure it out on his own and it comes with a book that has several configurations and games that can be created. I highly recommend and would purchase this again. My son already wants another set so he can expand the one he already has.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some parts do not work.
customer_reviews.text: We got this through Amazon's STEM Club Subscription and we reached build 6 to realize that push button A does not work, push button B works. I hope everything else works in this kit. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: TTShopper

customer_reviews.title: My 6 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first stem item for my 6 year old who is a lego genius! After explaining the basics in the book, he took off in exploring all the different things to build! Just make sure you have aa batteries handy!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This had potential but is too hard for my son. The wires are too hard to put in and out. He tried for about 20 min and got too frustrated and wont try it again. Maybe if they included some tools or made the connections not so tight.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C S

customer_reviews.title: Avoid. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Low quality. Poor fit. My bright 9 year old grandson and 11year old brother could not assemble and test the experiments.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Faris

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a 8-10 year olds
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old loves this gift. It definitely depends on the kid. My older son would not of been interested in this at his age. It is very easy yet still a challenge for my 9 year old to put all the different things together but is a great learning and fun for him.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Overway

customer_reviews.title: Works Good!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my great-grandson. He looks forward to the mail once a month and really gets into whatever that month's package contains. So glad I invested in this for him.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really cool
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING if you have a little curious scientist at home. My son is 5 so I have to do them with him and it’s mostly me but he is fascinated by it and it’s great. I got it on sale so idk if I’d spend the $40 but for half price definitely!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to learn about electricity
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son loves this set. He can create different games and circuits all by himself. The instructions are very easy to understand. There are a lot of small pieces- I recommend a special zipper pencil bag or box to store it in.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndiberri

customer_reviews.title: cooler than snap circuits!
customer_reviews.text: Gave these as a gift for my daughter's best friend. He loved them! You have more room for creativity than with snap circuits and it's a bit more technical. Very good gift for the 9+ yo getting interested in electricity/technology
customer_reviews.author: D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son. He enjoys it immensely, his friends do too. It comes with a very nice book with instructions and explanations. Overall I’d recommend this to anyone who wants to help their children understand the basics of how electronics work.
customer_reviews.author: David McNally

customer_reviews.title: One Happy Grandson
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12-year-old grandson for Christmas. He does well in math and science and this seemed right up his alley. He spent a couple of hours creating many of the projects listed. He's excited to try more. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: LoveToBuyQuality

customer_reviews.title: Great little starter set
customer_reviews.text: Already many hours of fun. Bought for a seven year old. Had to explain how to use it with a few pages is examples. From there he’s been off on his own building away.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two

customer_reviews.title: 11 yr old Grandson approved !
customer_reviews.text: My 11 yr old Grandson loves this set and has built a few of the projects. He keeps this one handy rather than moving it to the back of the closet so it must be a favorite. He has other kits and he has mentioned using parts of this with parts from those kits, or possibly using them, but I have no idea how or what.
customer_reviews.author: The Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: Like the kit. Bought for 10 and 11 years old. So many possibilities for kids to experiment, not just with the recommended items but you can try to experiment with many other fruits, vegetables and other items in your household. Keeps kids busy and creative. My kids having a blast.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Great idea- broken item
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to love it, bought it for my son's birthday but so many parts don't work and the return window closed the day before his birthday. Super bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My niece really likes it.
customer_reviews.text: The projects start really basic then get more complicated as they go. The booklet that is included explains how and why the project itself works which is great for a young kid as a starter pack for Arduino and Raspberry Pi's in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Good to teach kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 9year old niece to teach her about serial /parallel circuits and conductors/ non conductors. It has a book which has 50projects listed. It is cheaply built but it fulfilled the purpose which i bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Shaft

customer_reviews.title: Damaged box
customer_reviews.text: The product box was badly damaged but doesn't seem to have affected the product. We'll find out later when we work with it. Still, I've paid full price for something new that appears to be used.
customer_reviews.author: JennB

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quiet time activity
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old LOVES this set! While he needs my help to read what the different programs do, he has no problem following the diagrams to build the circuits himself. It's his favorite "quiet time" activity and he loves that there are so many building options.
customer_reviews.author: MomOnAMission

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to be honest. But this is actually really neat! My son loves it! Says it way better than the snap kind he uses in school. A must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: "It's the best gift I've ever gotten" - Arrow'dar 9 years old
customer_reviews.text: This is fabulous. I bought it as a gift for my grandson's 9th birthday. It has given him hours of fun. Most of the projects he can complete himself with light supervision and instruction, occasionally he needs help with troubleshooting. He told me it's the best gift he's every gotten. He and I both give it 5 stars all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: LaAura

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use, stimulating, and educational. Great first step to electronics. The instruction booklet follows a great order to build skills and provides just the right information to learn with each step. There are many projects to complete making the product even more valuable.
customer_reviews.author: angiesmom

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my 11 year old for his birthday. He loves it. Almost every night he wants to work on building a few circuits. He is learning a lot and its easy to use. This is a great gift for any child or teacher who loves STEM
customer_reviews.author: Meissa

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: My son is 10 and he likes. It is fun but it is very educational.. What kid doesn't like to put things together and see it actually works.
customer_reviews.author: prime shopper man

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, very educational (yet fun), great bonding times!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved it. I got it for my 8 year old sister and her face lit up when doing these experiments. It was such quality bonding time and I feel like this was a great way to get her interested in STEM because she's always saying how she thinks this is so cool. Some of the ideas in the book are absolutely amazing and great teaching tools. I was able to teach her how remote controls work and at the same time have fun playing spy and trying to sneak past the motion sensor. You should definitely get this for your kid(s), they won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Abir Taheer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for curious &  creative kids
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 9 year old grandson and he started playing with it right away, may need adult help with some of the construction but that is a plus for parent:child interaction
customer_reviews.author: val

customer_reviews.title: Great STEM gift for my 8 year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 year old son. He was certain is was gonna be “lame” he told me after the fact, but ended up loving it. It’s simple enough for someone young to follow along with, but still had some cool capabilities. The only thing wrong, is some of the pieces are hard to snap in and out, and the wire holes need to be used a few times before they loosen up.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Dell

customer_reviews.title: This a fun game. If you want to learn about circuits ...
customer_reviews.text: CIRCUTS! This a fun game. If you want to learn about circuits this is it. The instruction book is large print bright and nice colors. Adults who like games should try to learn what the kids are. STEM is for everyone!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun Christmas Present
customer_reviews.text: 8 year old Son got it for Christmas. Has been working on various projects for weeks now. He's really enjoyed the different projects and has been able to easily do them by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Olive

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My elder one already started working this like crazy n he is having fun and would recommend to any young geeks lol
customer_reviews.author: itsme

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great toy that makes the whole family use their brains.
customer_reviews.author: Dtwhite

customer_reviews.title: This is a great beginner’s kit that provides a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift for a child. It is a good beginners electronic device. Good, clear instructions. Two minor concerns: (1) the wires are hard to insert at times, and (2) a full-sized handle on a very small point Phillips screwdriver is needed to open the battery/power supply case.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: A must buy REAL STEM kit!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, one of the best educational toys I gifted to my Son. Very intuitive and most importantly he is glued trying out various activities for the last couple of days. A definite buy if you are into STEM related toys!
customer_reviews.author: HypersonicAviator

customer_reviews.title: Fun, challenging, but kids can figure out.
customer_reviews.text: Very fun and stimulating for my kids. Challenging but not difficult and something interesting other than video games.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! Even I wanted to play with it. The booklet was filled with great suggestions and really let's you and your child learn the basics before branching out to make other things.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth M.

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this set
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old son loves building things. This is easy enough for him to follow directions. He loves this set!
customer_reviews.author: MrsBeattie

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son is in HEAVEN with this. He's quite interested in STEM and this was perfect for him. Easy to understand instructions and everything worked well so far. He's done the first 4 items and cannot wait to continue doing more.
customer_reviews.author: Rauck

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for a growing mind!
customer_reviews.text: My son is almost 5 and he is obsessed with it. Finished the 50 experiments in 3 days and is looking for more. A great gift for a growing mind!
customer_reviews.author: Ecaterina M.

customer_reviews.title: For child’s inquisitive mind
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old granddaughter really enjoys this. She had no problem putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis W

product_meta.title: Smart Circuits
product_meta.description: Get with the programs! Explore unlimited electronic projects to create working games and gadgets with snap-together base boards, light and sound modules, a microprocessor, and jumper wires. Complete the circuit to make cool gadgets like a light-sensing electronic rooster, a musical baton, a doorbell, and a motion-sensing room alarm. Create fun games like a drag Race game that tests your reaction time Like a real drag racer, a version of the classic video game pong, and even a quiz show game. The 48-page lab manual includes step-by-step instructions for 50 sophisticated builds that teach kids about electronics, light, and sound—plus endless options to build custom creations.this exciting educational kit includes: microprocessor, speaker, battery pack, light sensor, tricolor LED array, tilt switch, variable resistor, 2 push buttons, 6 modular boards, 31 Jumper wires in 4 lengths, and a 48-page manual. Requires 3 x 1.5V AAA (LR03) batteries, not included.
feature_bullets: Hours of STEM electronics fun: build amazing gadgets and games with lights, sounds, and Sensors using the modular system and microprocessor; customize your electronic builds in 3-D with snap-together boards

48 pieces, amazing value: microprocessor, speaker, battery pack, light sensor, tricolor LED array, tilt switch, variable resistor, 2 push buttons, 6 modular boards, 31 Jumper wires in 4 lengths, and 48-page manual; requires 3 x 1.5V AAA (LR03) batteries, not included

48-Page illustrated manual packed with science: using the scientific method to make your way through the 50 step-by-step projects, learn about electricity, Electric currents, Electric circuits, conductance, microprocessors, rom, ram, sound frequency, RGB color, and more

50 fun circuit builds—unlimited projects: first 10 builds teach the basics of electronics, then advance in complexity; create a doorbell and a motion-sensing alarm for you room, make electronic dice and a pong game, use a Pencil to draw music you can hear, create a magic message wand, and more
Perfect for budding computer Scientists ages 8+: kids can gain confidence as they build on their own or you can bond as a family as you create the projects together

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
